column4: it seems to be in fedora and also for os-x so makes me think it maybe

DIanWei probably
DIanWei also need the libwxgtk libwxgtkgl and libwxgtk-devel also
WOO HOO my new Senao Wireless card just arrived from the postman :-)
200mW with Prism 2.5 chipset and 2 x External Antenna Jacks
How sad is it that i can get so excited over some new hardware
LOL
that is a good nic.  It should work well.
Yeah i had to search around a bit for a UK supplier but i am so fed up with all the problems the various wireless nics got under Linux
On my Prism 2 and 2.5 card, I never had any problem under Linux.  I just plug them in and they work.  I use them at the local library and at a local restaurant.

Orinoco have to contqastantly patch the kernel for RFMON my cisco aironet card the UBUNTU 2.6.12 kernel is broken and cant work properly as the kernel is broken (which is completely un-accpetable to break such an old and solid chipsetset driver)
i have various other wireless nics that i can get working with ndiswrappers but they wont support RFMON either
The cisco aironet card is absolutely fantastic and a very capable card i cannot believe the kernel guys have broken the kernel for these cards
I have heard the Prism 3 chipset isnt so great under Linux tho
which is a shame as the senao prism 3 card with 2 x externals was a third of the price
which would have been an absolute bargain at 15 by any standards
I don't have any with 2 antennae.  But, mine were all prety cheap  The most I paid was $20.  I imagine 2 attannae helps the range.

yes i got a real cheap external omni antenna and it performs really well my only hassle now is getting my GPS to work through my usb to serial adapter which i had working under Hoary but i havnt managed to get it working under breezy and like an idiot i forgot to write down the settings befire i upgraded and cant get it working for the life of me now :-(
